description:
Detects the use of Ngrok, a utility used for port forwarding and tunneling, often used by threat actors to make local protected services publicly available.
Involved domains are bin.equinox.io for download and *.ngrok.io for connections.
author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)
false_positives: Another tool that uses the command line switches of Ngrok
name: PUA - Ngrok Execution
query: ((process.command_line.text:("*\ tcp\ 139*" OR "*\ tcp\ 445*" OR "*\ tcp\ 3389*" OR "*\ tcp\ 5985*" OR "*\ tcp\ 5986*")) OR ((process.command_line.text:"*\ start\ *" AND process.command_line.text:"*\-\-all*" AND process.command_line.text:"*\-\-config*" AND process.command_line.text:"*.yml*")) OR ((process.executable.text:"*ngrok.exe" AND process.command_line.text:("*\ tcp\ *" OR "*\ http\ *" OR "*\ authtoken\ *"))) OR (process.command_line.text:("*.exe\ authtoken\ *" OR "*.exe\ start\ \-\-all*")))
